hack: Line your fridge shelves with plastic wrap — easy cleanup when things spill!
Freeze fresh herbs in olive oil in ice cube trays for instant flavor bombs.
Use a spoon to peel ginger in seconds — way faster than a knife.
Add a pinch of salt to your coffee grounds to reduce bitterness.
Crack eggs on a flat surface, not the edge of a bowl — fewer shell pieces!
Keep brown sugar soft by storing it with a slice of bread or marshmallow.
Use dental floss to cut perfect slices of cake or cheese.
Warm a lemon in the microwave for 15 seconds — doubles the juice yield!
Peel garlic easily: microwave for 10 seconds or shake in a jar.
Cut cherry tomatoes in half all at once between two lids and slice!
Revive stale bread: run under water briefly, then bake at 150°C for 6–8 mins.
Use a wine bottle as a rolling pin in a pinch.
Grate cold butter into flour for perfect flaky pastry every time.
Freeze leftover wine in ice cube trays for cooking later.
Use a hot spoon to easily scoop out squash or pumpkin seeds.
Store onions in pantyhose: tie knots between each onion for long-lasting freshness.

Use a potato peeler to shave chocolate for desserts.
Keep herbs fresh longer by storing them upright in water in the fridge.
